revised_title: The Autobiography of John Wallis and its Historical Significance
tldr: This article presents the autobiography of John Wallis, a prominent 17th-century mathematician and Savilian Professor of Geometry at Oxford. The autobiography provides valuable insights into Wallis's life, his contributions to the origins of the Royal Society, and his involvement in the Assembly of Divines at Westminster in the 1640s. The article also discusses the historical significance of Wallis's autobiography and its relevance to the understanding of the scientific and religious landscape of the time.
